conclusion: Objects A and B are moved and placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F.
Placement is such that A and B come into contact with C, D, E, F due to gravity.
Gravity pulls objects downwards until supported by something below.
Objects C and D are located in one area, and objects E and F are located in another area. Arrow for A points towards C and D, and arrow for B points towards E and F.
A is placed down in the area of C and D and comes into contact with them due to gravity, so A will rest on top of C and/or D.
B is placed down in the area of E and F and comes into contact with them due to gravity, so B will rest on top of E and/or F.
Objects A and B will be supported by objects C, D, E, and F.
